intro: Trichilia pteleifolia, commonly known as the African snowball tree, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other tropical hardwoods. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves, which are pinnately arranged and often have a distinctive leaflet shape. Its flowers are small and white, forming spherical clusters that give the plant its common name. The tree is valued for its ornamental appearance and has traditional uses in some African cultures.
